properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 2 at 5:54AM PST until February 3 at 12:02AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning has ended for the following rivers in
Washington...

Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls affecting King County

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Washington...

Nooksack River At Ferndale affecting Whatcom County
Skagit River Near Mt. Vernon affecting Skagit County
Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County
Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County
Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County
Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County
White River 10 N R Street Bridge affecting King and Pierce Counties


Showers will decrease today. Hydrologically significant
precipitation is not expected for the next couple of days.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Nooksack River At Ferndale
* Until late tonight.
* At  5:30 AM Sunday the stage was 20.9 feet.
* Flood stage is 18.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river crested at 20.9 feet at 5 AM Sunday and will
continue to fall to below flood stage late this afternoon.
* Impact...At 20.5 feet, the Nooksack River will overflow levees and
banks along the east bank of the river from Hovander Park
downstream to Marietta, causing widespread flooding from near
Ferndale downstream to the mouth...with swift waters in residential
areas and over farm lands and roads. Erosion may damage some river
banks.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.

NWSheadline: Flood Warning extended until late tonight
